election_record.label: New York 1809 State Senate, Eastern District

candidate.name: Stearns
candidate.note: Listed as Doctor Stearns of Waterford.

overview.note: The Farmer's Register lists Daniel Paris as Daniel Parris.
Kinner Newcomb, Gates Hoyt, Abraham Van Vechten, John A. Ferris, William A. Moore, Jonathan Dorr, Simon Stevens, Jr., and Ebenezer Stevens were candidates for Assembly.

sub_unit.name: Albany
sub_unit.note: The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 12 and The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 5 each list the vote totals for Albany County to be 1636 and 1638 for John Stearns and Daniel Paris, respectively. However, the actual sums of the town totals as they list them are 1635 and 1637, respectively.

sub_unit.name: One
sub_unit.note: The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), June 30, reports 59 votes for Simon Veeder in Ward One.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The returns from Franklin County were not reported in the Official Canvass printed in The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 6, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), June 30. These figures come from a footnote to the Official Canvass published by Utica Patriot (Utica, NY), June 13. The Albany Register (Albany, NY): "The return from Franklin County was a mere statement of votes by the clerk, and not a transcript of the original returns from the different towns and therefore rejected."

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: John Stearns received 2 votes as Jno. Stearns.
Daniel Paris received 2 votes as Dan'l Paris.
Simon Veeder received 21 votes as Simon Vedder and 1 vote as Simon Veter.

sub_unit.name: Broadalbin
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 9, American Citizen (New York, NY), May 12, Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 12, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 16, report 134 votes for Simon Veeder and 136 votes for Adam Comstock in Broadalbin. The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 6 reports 194 votes for Simon Veeder and 196 votes for Adam Comstock.

sub_unit.name: Canajoharie
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 12, Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 12, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 16, report 141 votes for John Stearns, 143 votes for Daniel Paris, and 146 votes for Adam Comstock in Canajoharie.

sub_unit.name: Johnstown
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY) and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 12, report 219 votes for Simon Veeder in Johnstown.

sub_unit.name: Manheim
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 12, Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 12, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 16, report 67 votes for Simon Veeder in Manheim.

sub_unit.name: Palatine
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 9, the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 12, the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 12, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 16, report 160 votes for John Stearns in Palatine.

sub_unit.name: Rensselaer
sub_unit.note: Lansingburgh Gazette, May 9, The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 5, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 12, report 1798 votes for John Stearns and 1797 votes for Daniel Paris in Rensselaer County.
Troy Gazette (Troy, NY) reports 1795 votes for John Stearns in Rensselaer County.

sub_unit.name: Berlin
sub_unit.note: Troy Gazette (Troy, NY), Farmers' Register (Troy, NY), Lansingburgh Gazette, May 9, The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 5, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 12,report 145 votes for Daniel Paris in Berlin.

sub_unit.name: Stephentown
sub_unit.note: Lansingburgh Gazette, May 9, The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 5, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 12, report 208 votes for John Stearns and 210 votes for Daniel Paris in Stephentown.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: Simon Veeder received 7 votes as Simeon Veeder and 1 vote as Smon Veeder.
Adam Comstock received 4 votes as Adam Comsock.

The Independent American (Ballston Spa, NY), American Citizen (New York, NY), May 20, Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 23, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 23, report 1153 votes for John Stearns in Saratoga County.
In a probable typographical error, The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 23, reports 1143 votes for Daniel Paris in Saratoga County.

sub_unit.name: Moreau
sub_unit.note: The Independent American (Ballston Spa, NY), American Citizen (New York, NY), May 20, Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 23, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 23, report 24 votes for John Stearns in Moreau.

sub_unit.name: Schenectady
sub_unit.note: Simon Veeder received 2 votes as Simon Vedner.
The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), June 30, reports 468 votes for Simon Veeder in Schenectady County; however, the sum of totals per town is 458.

The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 9, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), June 2, report 473 votes for Simon Veeder in Schenectady County; however, the sum of totals per town is 467.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 9, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), June 2, report 469 votes for Adam Comstock in Schenectady County.

sub_unit.name: Niskayuna
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 9, and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), June 2, report 19 votes for Simon Veeder and 20 votes for Adam Comstock in Niskayuna.

sub_unit.name: Three
sub_unit.note: The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), June 30, reports 44 votes for Simon Veeder in Ward Three.

"Last year, fellow-citizens, you were presented with a statement from the third ward, giving the federal candidates a plurality of 87 votes. I then unequivocally declared that this could not have been effected by fair means, and that the boxes were pilfered by the midnight robber. The difference between the Senator and Assembly canvass was, to my mind, sufficient evidence of the infamy of the transaction. -- But when I examined the affidavits of those men who had sworn in what manner they had voted, I had no longer any hesitation in forming my opinion, that the boxes must have been robbed by night, and other ballots put in the place of those stolen. If any thing was wanting to complete the proof, that infamy was perpetrated, it is the following statement -- from which it appears, that in that ward the votes on both sides were equal for Assembly. There have also been two elections for Assistant Alderman, and in both the federal and repubican candidates were equal. -- Such, citizens, are the means by which these men think of succeeding -- and can you submit to be deceived and deprived of your suffrages by such infamous conduct? You have already answered, No! -- Fellow-citizens of the third ward, you have evinced by your votes and vigilance, that the vile machinations of designing men cannot always succeed." Western Budget (Schenectady, NY). May 1, 1810.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: Simon Veeder received 1 vote as Simeon Veeder.

sub_unit.name: Cambridge
sub_unit.note: The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 26, and Lansingburgh Gazette report 397 votes for John Stearns in Cambridge.

sub_unit.name: Easton
sub_unit.note: The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 26, reports 81 votes for Daniel Paris in Easton.

sub_unit.name: Hague
sub_unit.note: The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 26, reports 6 votes for John Stearns in Hague.

sub_unit.name: Hartford
sub_unit.note: The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 26, and Lansingburgh Gazette report 107 votes for Simon Veeder and 107 votes for Adam Comstock in Hartford.

sub_unit.name: Salem
sub_unit.note: The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY), May 26, and Lansingburgh Gazette report 141 votes for Simon Veeder in Salem.
